description:
During the event period, you can tap the "Start" button located 
on the Home Screen then tap on "World Tournament" to access 
the World Tournament main page.

You can participate in {color: #FFFF00}tournaments{color} during 
the event period of the World Tournament. 

A tournament consists of various rounds (preliminaries, 
semifinals, etc.), and in each round, players will 
compete against each other to see who can collect 
the most {color: #FFFF00}Tournament Points{color}.

Fight your way through the tournament, earn 
Tournament Points and claim the coveted seat of champion! 

Rack up Tournament Points to enter the rankings 
and win rewards!

There is no limit to how many times you can 
enter a tournament during the event period, 
so don't give up even if you are defeated!

You can enter the World Tournament at any time 
when the "{color: #FFFF00}Participate{color}" button is available 
on the World Tournament main page.

You can pick up from a previous tournament session
by tapping the "{color: #FFFF00}Continue{color}" button.

The team participating in a tournament can also 
be selected in Quests and Events. However, please 
note that the {color: #FFFF00}formation{color} of that team cannot be edited 
until the current tournament session is over.

After a round concludes, you will immediately proceed 
to the next one without the team's HP being recovered, 
so keep an eye on your item stock. 

A tournament session will end when the following 
situations occur. 
- Winning in the final. 
- Retiring during the session. 
- Game over resulted from 0 HP. 
- Failing to proceed to the next round. 
- Selecting "Abandon Quest" during battles.

Your performance in the World Tournament is judged by 
the number of your {color: #FFFF00}Tournament Points{color}, which can be 
earned through winning rounds (e.g. the preliminary), 
winning battles or landing on certain tiles. 

The sum of these points will be the {color: #FFFF00}"Points Earned"{color}.

Your {color: #FFFF00}"Total Tournament Points"{color} represent your 
overall performance during the event period. 

When a round (preliminaries, semifinals, finals, etc.) is over, 
the Tournament Points you have earned in that round will 
be added to your Total Tournament Points.

If you choose to retire in the middle of a tournament, 
all the points you earned before retiring will be added 
to your Total Tournament Points. However, if you are 
defeated (GAME OVER) or choose to "Abandon Quest" 
on the map (battles), the points you earned in that round 
will be discarded and only the other points earned in that 
tournament will be added to your Total Tournament Points. 

To play it safe or to aim to become champion- 
make your choices strategically and wisely 
based on your team's strength. 

Please note that if you win battles after the event period 
of the World Tournament ends, the points collected will 
not be added to your Total Tournament Points. 

Your Total Tournament Points will be reset 
when the World Tournament ends.
The {color: #FFFF00}rankings{color} are based on your {color: #FFFF00}Total Tournament Points{color}.

Your ranking at the end of the World Tournament will 
decide the rewards you will get. (Players with the same 
Total Tournament Points will get the same ranking.) 

You can tap the "Switch" button to check the number 
of wins or the longest win streak. 

* During the event period, rankings are not updated 
in real time. It may take several minutes before the 
latest information appears.

Your {color: #FFFF00}"Tier"{color} will be raised as you accumulate
{color: #FFFF00}Total Tournament Points{color}.

All players will start from "Pilaf Tier" at the commencement 
of the World Tournament. Try your best to defeat other 
competitors and aim to raise your Tier! 

The Tiers are divided into 4 leagues. The higher the league, 
the better the rewards you will receive.

In the World Tournament, you will not be able to enjoy 
the benefits your {color: #FFFF00}Friend{color} grants you in Quests. 

1. The Leader Skill of your Friend will not be activated.
2. You will not receive Friend Points.

Just like in Quests, in the World Tournament you move
according to the number button on which you tap.

* The number buttons are generated randomly.

In the World Tournament, your opponents will also 
select numbers to move around on the map. 
After everyone has selected a number, the player 
with the smallest number will move first.

Like normal Quests, there are different kinds of {color: #FFFF00}tiles{color} 
on the map in the World Tournament.

After a certain number of rounds, 
the tiles will reappear on the map. 

Your opponents can also run into different 
kinds of events when they land on tiles, 
so try to land on tiles you are aiming for 
before your opponent does! 

In addition, special tiles that do not appear 
in Quests will appear in the World Tournament. 

{color: #FFFF00}Meat Buns{color}
Land on a tile with a Meat Bun icon to recover HP.
{color: #FFFF00}Tournament Points{color}

Land on a tile with a Tournament Point icon 
to get Tournament Points.
{color: #FFFF00}Characters{color}
Land on a tile with a Character icon to recruit a character.

The items or characters found on the map will 
be acquired or recruited after the round ends.

However, if you are defeated or choose to 
"Abandon Quest", you will not be able to obtain and 
recruit the items and characters you have found.

In the World Tournament, exploration of the map 
will end under the following conditions. 

- Your HP drops to 0. 
- All other teams are eliminated. 
- The given rounds are up. 
- You choose to "Abandon Quest" from "Menu", 
   which is located at the bottom-right of the screen.

One round passes when every player has finished moving 
around the map. The given number of rounds varies 
according to each round (preliminaries, semifinals, etc.).

Battles in the World Tournament adopt the rule of {color: #FFFF00}7{color} on {color: #FFFF00}7{color}, 
including your Friend.

All the opponents have their own HP. Also, 
please note that your Friend's Leader Skill 
will not be activated in the World Tournament. 

The icons of opponents that will attack you 
in the round will be marked with a yellow frame 
on the upper side of your screen. 

Just as in other battles, you can choose your target, 
use items, launch Super Attacks and enter Dokkan Mode.

In battles, {color: #FFFF00}Tournament Points{color} can be obtained 
in the following ways. 

1. Collecting Ki Spheres. (You will get more points if the 
    collected Ki Spheres match the character's Type.) 
2. Defeating the opponent by dropping their HP to 0. 
3. Defeating the opponent's team. 

In addition, you will receive extra points if you bring 
an opponent's HP to 0 with a Super Attack or with 
a character of an advantageous Type. The extra points 
received will also vary according to the opponent's level.

Battles end under the following situations. 

- Your HP drops to 0. 
- All the characters on the opponent's team are defeated. 
- The given number of charges are up. 
- You choose to "Abandon Quest" from "Menu", 
   which is located at the bottom-right of the screen.

One charge passes after a character collects Ki Spheres. 
The number of remaining charges will be shown on the screen.

The given number of charges varies according 
to each round (preliminaries, semifinals, etc.).

You can obtain various {color: #FFFF00}rewards{color} in the World Tournament. 

The rewards collected in a round will be acquired after the 
round ends. However, if you are defeated (GAME OVER) or 
select "Abandon Quest", you will not be able to acquire 
these rewards. 

Unlike other battles, you will not gain Friend Points, and you gain 
character EXP after the round ends, not directly after the battle.

After the World Tournament ends, {color: #FFFF00}ranking rewards{color} 
will be distributed according to your ranking, which 
is decided by your Total Tournament Points. 

Please refer to the "Reward" page on the World Tournament 
main page for more information on ranking rewards.

The reward distribution period will vary according to each World 
Tournament. Please refer to the announcements for details.

Rewards can be obtained by completing missions 
related to the World Tournament.

Please navigate the following path for more information 
on missions and rewards: "World Tournament main page" 
--> "Reward" --> "Missions".

In addition, some missions will be listed under 
"Daily Missions" or "Event Missions".

Please tap the "Mission" button located on the Home Screen 
for more information. 

Note that you will not be able to claim Daily Mission rewards 
if they are not claimed before the daily update of the missions. 
Please check the details of each mission for the deadline.

In addition to defeating opponents, Tournament Points 
can also be gained as bonuses in other ways. 

The more rounds (the number of moves left on the map) left 
before the round concludes, the more extra points you will get. 

Moreover, Bonus Teams will appear randomly.

You can earn more Tournament Points than usual 
by defeating opponents from Bonus Teams. Information 
regarding bonuses will be displayed on the result page.

Local Ranking is a ranking in which a small number of players 
compete against each other. 

The rankings are determined based on {color: #FFFF00}the number of 
Tournament Points players earn while the Local Ranking 
is being held.{color}

Rewards are given out according to the final rankings 
after the event period ends. Players who earn the 
same number of Tournament Points will be given 
the same ranking. 

* During the event period, rankings are not updated 
in real time. It may take several minutes before the 
latest information appears.

Rankings are determined based on the number of Tournament 
Points you earn while the Local Ranking is being held. Rewards 
are given out according to the final rankings.

You can check the available rewards by tapping 
"Reward" on the World Tournament main page. 

Once the final rankings have been calculated after the event 
period of the Local Ranking ends, you can confirm your rewards 
on the Home Screen or the World Tournament main page. 
* Rewards can be claimed from the Gift Box.

The Win Streak Bonus allows you to receive {color: #FFFF00}extra 
Tournament Points{color} when consecutive wins are achieved.

The Win Streak Bonus is an additional bonus added 
to your regular Win Bonus. Your Victory Points are 
therefore calculated using these two bonuses. 

Example: In the case of Victory Points x1.3, 
the bonus is made up of two parts: 
the Win Bonus (1) + Win Streak Bonus (0.3).

Your Win Streak Bonus grows as you rack up 
more wins in a row, but it stops increasing after 
your ninth consecutive win. It will reset if you lose or 
retire during a tournament, but you can start another 
Win Streak Bonus by winning consecutively again. 

* The Win Streak Bonus will be reset at the start of 
each World Tournament. It cannot be carried over 
from the previous World Tournament.

You can select your Ambition by tapping the 
"Participate" button on the World Tournament main page.

The Ambition you select will determine the strength 
of your opponents in the tournament. Based on your 
choice, an Ambition Bonus will also be added to your 
Victory Bonus (bonus for winning the preliminaries, 
bonus for winning the tournament etc.). 

In the case of Victory Bonus x10, for example, the bonus 
is made up of two parts: the regular Victory Bonus (1) + 
Ambition Bonus (9).
You cannot change your Ambition after entering a tournament.

You can view more details on the Ambition you have 
selected by tapping "Ambition" at the upper part of 
the "Check Progress" screen.
